body: Ionic Framework provides a set of CSS utility classes that can be used on any element in order to modify the text, element placement or adjust the padding and margin.
If your app was not started using an available Ionic Framework starter, the stylesheets listed in the
optional section of the global stylesheets
will need to be included in order for these styles to work.

The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box.
The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box.
The inline contents are centered within the line box.
The inline contents are justified. Text should be spaced to line up its left and right edges to the left and right edges of the line box, except for the last line.
Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Newline characters in the source are handled as other whitespace. Breaks lines as necessary to fill line boxes.
, but suppresses line breaks (text wrapping) within text.

Forces all characters to be converted to uppercase.
Forces all characters to be converted to lowercase.
Forces the first letter of each word to be converted to uppercase.

The float CSS property specifies that an element should be placed along the left or right side of its container, where text and inline elements will wrap around it. This way, the element is taken from the normal flow of the web page, though still remaining a part of the flow, contrary to absolute positioning.

The element will float on the right side of its containing block.

The display CSS property determines if an element should be visible or not. The element will still be in the DOM, but not rendered, if it is hidden.

The padding class sets the padding area of an element. The padding area is the space between the content of the element and its border.
section for more information on how to change these values.
Applies padding to the top and bottom.
Applies padding to the left and right.
Applies no padding to all sides.
The margin area extends the border area with an empty area used to separate the element from its neighbors.
section for more information on how to change these values.
Applies margin to the top and bottom.
Applies margin to the left and right.
Applies no margin to all sides.
Items are packed toward the start on the main axis.
Items are packed toward the end on the main axis.
Items are centered along the main axis.
Items are evenly distributed on the main axis with equal space around them.
Items are evenly distributed on the main axis.
Items are distributed so that the spacing between any two items is equal.
Items are packed toward the start on the cross axis.
Items are packed toward the end on the cross axis.
Items are centered along the cross axis.
Items are aligned so that their baselines align.
Items are stretched to fill the container.
Items will all be on one line.
Items will wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.
Items will wrap onto multiple lines, from bottom to top.
Item is packed toward the start on the cross axis.
Item is packed toward the end on the cross axis.
Item is centered along the cross axis.
Item is aligned so that its baseline aligns with other item baselines.
Item is stretched to fill the container.
Item is positioned according to the parent's
The border display CSS property determines if the border should be visible or not. The property can be applied to the ion-header and the ion-footer.
The element will have no border.

Ionic uses breakpoints in media queries in order to style an application differently based on the screen size. The following breakpoint names are used in the utility classes listed above, where the class will apply when the width is met.
title: CSS Utilities
